metadata.Title: CVE-2018-16850 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
postgresql before versions 11.1, 10.6 is vulnerable to a to SQL injection in pg_upgrade and pg_dump via CREATE TRIGGER ... REFERENCING. Using a purpose-crafted trigger definition, an attacker can cause arbitrary SQL statements to run, with superuser privileges.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-16850` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libecpg-compat3 - 10.6-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libecpg6 - 10.6-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libpgtypes3 - 10.6-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libpq5 - 10.6-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-10 - 10.6-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-client-10 - 10.6-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-plperl-10 - 10.6-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-plpython-10 - 10.6-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-plpython3-10 - 10.6-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-pltcl-10 - 10.6-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: mdeslaur> only affects 10.x and 11.x per upstream security page

criterions.comment: postgresql-10 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '10.6-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
